([[Founder CEO|Founder]] & [[Chief Revenue Officer|CRO]]) | num_employees = 19 | registration = Required | commercial = Yes | area_served = [[United States]], [[Australia]] and [[India]] | alexa = | subsid = | url = {{URL|https://www.videoken.com/}} | current_status = Online }} '''VideoKen Inc.''' (earlier known as Yen4Ken Inc.) is an [[Artificial intelligence|AI]] [[Product (business)|product]] company headquartered in [[Princeton, New Jersey]] with a subsidiary in [[Bangalore]], [[India]].{{cite news|last1=Srivastav|first1=Shivam |title=The Xerox effect: Former employees of the company are launching their own innovative startups|url=https://factordaily.com/xerox-technology-startups-innovation/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=FactorDaily}}{{cite news|last1=Pitchiah|first1=Vijayakumar|title=Flipkart CTO, others invest in video-learning platform VideoKen|url=https://www.vccircle.com/flipkart-cto-others-invest-in-video-learning-platform-videoken/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[VCCircle]]|date=20 April 2017}}{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Video Learning Platform VideoKen Secures $1M Funding in the Seed Round|url=http://bwdisrupt.businessworld.in/article/Video-Learning-Platform-VideoKen-Secures-1M-Funding-in-the-Seed-Round/21-04-2017-116822/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[Businessworld]]|date=21 April 2017}}It works on advanced video indexing technologies, which are built on a foundation of cutting edge [[research]] involving [[Big data|Big Data]] [[analytics]], [[Machine learning|Machine Learning]] and [[Artificial intelligence|Artificial Intelligence]]. VideoKen holds multiple granted and pending [[United States Patent and Trademark Office|US patents]] in [[video]] [[technology]]. VideoKen enables videos with [[Table of contents|Table of Contents]] (index) and [[Tag cloud|Phrase Cloud]] (glossary) - like a [[digital textbook]] - along with other features to make videos more consumable. VideoKen has raised $1 million from a consortium of [[Angel investor|angel investors]] including LG Chandrasekhar, [[chairman]] of Sutures India and SRI Capital, led by [[Sashi Reddi]] and others, including some former and current executives of [[Flipkart]].{{cite news|last1=Mishra|first1=Digbijay |title=VideoKen gets $1 million from Flipkart execs, others|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/venture-capital/videoken-gets-1-million-from-flipkart-execs-others/articleshow/58272277.cms|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[The Times of India]]}}{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=AI and ML-based collaborative learning platform VideoKen raises $1 million seed funding|url=https://thetechportal.com/2017/04/22/videoken-raises-seed-funding/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=The Tech Portal}}{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Funding Galore: Indian Startup Fundings Of The Week|url=https://inc42.com/buzz/funding-galore-142/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=Inc42}} == History == VideoKen was founded in January 2017 by Manish Gupta, former [[Vice President]] (VP) and [[Director (business)|Director]], [[Xerox]] Research India and Ashish Vikram, a former VP at [[Flipkart]]. The company is headquartered in Princeton, New Jersey and has a subsidiary in [[Bangalore]], India. It has launched pilots in [[India]], [[Australia]], and the [[United States]]. VideoKen evolved out of the TutorSpace project at Xerox Research.{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Edutech firms hopes to offer more personalised services|url=https://tech.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/startups/edutech-firms-hopes-to-offer-more-personalised-services/55826939|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[The Economic Times]]}}{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=TutorSpace: At-Scale Personalized Learning|url=http://www.xrci.xerox.com/tutorSpace-at-scale-personalized-learning|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[Xerox]]}} The company purchased multiple [[Patent application|patent applications]] and other [[Intellectual property|IP]] from [[Xerox]]. ==Funding== VideoKen raised seed funding of $1 million in April 2017 from a consortium of angel investors which include LG Chandrasekhar, [[chairman]] of Sutures India and SRI Capital, led by [[Sashi Reddi]], and some former and current executives of Flipkart. Among the Flipkart executives, Ravi Garikipati ([[Chief Technical Officer|CTO]]), Surojeet Chatterjee (former [[Senior Vice President]] (SVP) and Product Head), Hari Vasudevan (SVP) and Ashish Agarwal (SVP) have contributed to the funding. Ajay Lavakare, Co-President Stanford Angels and Entrepreneurs and other high net worth individuals from the [[US]] and [[Singapore]] have also participated in the round. == Awards and recognition== * Selected among top 100 most innovative startups in [[Karnataka]].{{cite news|last1=Balasubramanyam|first1=K R |title=Karnataka picks up 100 most innovative startups, to give Rs 35 Cr in funding|url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/small-biz/startups/karnataka-picks-up-100-most-innovative-startups-to-give-rs-35-cr-in-funding/articleshow/60294651.cms|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[The Economic Times]]}} * Microsoft Accelerator picks VideoKen for 11th [[Cohort (educational group)|Cohort]].{{cite news|last1=Chakraberty|first1=Sumit |title=Microsoft accelerator picks 14 startups it can connect with global clients|url=https://www.techinasia.com/microsoft-accelerator-picks-14-enterprise-tech-startups|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=Tech in Asia|date=24 August 2017}}{{cite news|last1=|first1=|title=Microsoft Accelerator announces 11th start-up cohort|url=http://www.financialexpress.com/industry/technology/microsoft-accelerator-announces-11th-start-up-cohort/821606/|accessdate=3 December 2017|work=[[The Financial Express (India)]]}} == See also == {{Portal bar|Software|Internet|Companies|India}} * [[Social learning network]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|www.videoken.com/}} [[Category:Companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in Princeton, New Jersey]] [[Category:Software companies established in 2017]] [[Category:Educational software]] [[Category:Social networks]] [[Category:2017 establishments in New Jersey]] {{India-company-stub}}

'''Wide Area GPS Enhancement''' (WAGE) is a method to increase the horizontal accuracy of the [[GPS]] encrypted [[GPS signals|P(Y) Code]] by adding additional range correction data to the satellite broadcast navigation message.
Per a 1997 article, the navigation message for each satellite is updated once daily or as needed. This daily update of each satellite navigation message contains the range corrections for all the satellites in the constellation. Thus, more timely range correction information would be available for each satellite, resulting in increased horizontal accuracy. Potential improvements to the system include simplifying the upload procedure, uploading the data more often, and adding more monitor stations for better range correction.
WAGE is available only to the Precise Positioning Service (PPS) or P(Y) Code receivers. It requires at least 12.5 minutes to obtain the most recent WAGE data. After that, the process of using the corrections data is automatic and transparent to the operator. Any time the receiver is on, it continually collects WAGE data (whether the WAGE mode is on or off). The receiver always uses the most recent WAGE data available to calculate position and it will not use the data that is over 6 hours old.
A 1996 evaluation using a [[PLGR]] (a 5-channel L2 GPS receiver) found no clear advantage to using WAGE in its then-current configuration. Its overall average error of 9.1 meters was worse than when WAGE was not used.
However, the specifications information for the [[Defense Advanced GPS Receiver]], which has replaced the PLGR, lists its WAGE accuracy as better than 4.82 m, 95% Horizontal. PPS accuracy has improved beyond WAGE specification and accuracy improvement from WAGE is now negligible. Modern receivers & atomic clocks on a chip will also outperform WAGE. Some theorize that restrictions imposed by WAGE may limit precision for both C/A, P(Y), & WAGE users more than what it provides to WAGE users only.
The capability of WAGE has been superseded by Talon NAMATH. There is a push for WAGE users to upgrade to Talon NAMATH or move them to using P(Y) alone. This could lift WAGE restrictions & allow accuracy improvements for all users.
== Sources == * [http://www.gpsworld.com/gnss-system/perspectives-august-2008-7256 Talon NAMATH, Link 16, ZOAD, SBIR, and Other Code Words] * [http://www.fs.fed.us/eng/pubs/htmlpubs/htm97712327/index.htm Wide Area GPS Enhancement (WAGE) Evaluation] * [http://www.aero.org/publications/crosslink/summer2002/04.html Orbit Determination and Satellite Navigation] Crosslink Summer 2002. {{Geo-term-stub}} [[Category:Global Positioning System]]

{{advert|date=June 2017}} '''YANGAROO''' (TSXV: YOO) is a Canadian company specializing in providing technology solutions for the music, advertising, and awards industries. It was founded in 1999 by Cliff Hunt and David Staples.
==DMDS: Digital Media Distribution System== '''Digital Media Distribution System (DMDS)''' is a patented service of YANGAROO Inc.
YANGAROO, powered by DMDS, is a secure distribution tool for audio and video media via the internet and is used by industry professionals. Systems like DMDS make it possible for broadcasters, TV advertisers, and post-production companies to move away from physical media like [[DigiBeta]] tapes to digital [[Digital cinematography#File-based workflows|file based workflows]].
The DMDS service supports: :* Broadcast quality music video and television advertising distribution :* Award show content distribution and voting :* Music distribution to radio, TV, and industry professionals.
'''YANGAROO Music''' provides programmers, broadcasters, journalists and other industry professionals with the ability to preview and download pre-release media from music professionals including major record labels and independents.<ref name="Saving the Music Industry - Environmentally at least">{{cite web |url=http://www.fastcompany.com/blog/rachel-king/geek-style/saving-music-industry-environmentally-least |title=Saving the Music Industry -- Environmentally, At Least |publisher=Fast Company |date=2008-09-04 |first=Rachel |last=King}}</ref> Organizations like [[MTV]] have selected DMDS to manage their digital video submission process and to review materials for broadcast.<ref name="MTV Picks Yangaroo for Video Workflow">{{cite web |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/mtv-selects-yangaroos-dmds-to-power-and-secure-online-review-and-voting-for-the-2012-mtv-movie-awards-148903925.html |title=MTV Picks Yangaroo for Video Workflow |publisher=gigaom |date=2010-04-15 |first=Ryan |last=Lawler}}</ref>
'''YANGAROO Advertising''' is used by [[post-production]] facilities and advertising agencies to expedite the delivery of advertising content to broadcasters, utilizing [[Digital cinematography#File-based workflows|file based workflows]].
'''YANGAROO Awards''' is used by associations for submission and adjudication of Award Show entries. Groups like [[NARAS]] (The [[Grammy Awards]] <ref name="Grammy Judges Vet Nominees Online">{{cite web |last=Taylor |first=Marissa |title=Grammy Judges Vet Nominees Online |publisher=The Wall Street Journal |date=2009-10-14 |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/digits/2009/10/14/grammy-judges-vet-nominees-online/}}</ref> <ref name="Grammys Go Digital Via Canadian Technology">{{cite web |last=Vlessing |first=Eton |title=Grammys Go Digital Via Canadian Technology |publisher=The Hollywood Reporter |date=2009-10-13 |url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/news/e3iad5ddf5ece450a18e426101525f60a4e}}</ref>) and [[CARAS]] (The [[Juno Awards]]) utilize the system to manage their Awards shows.
==Key Partnerships== In December 2014, YANGAROO announced a partnership with IMD Fastrax, the music distribution arm of leading global delivery logistic company, IMD. The partnership will enable North American record labels and recording artists to deliver their music videos to the UK & Ireland via the IMD Fastrax platform.<ref name="YANGAROO Announces Partnership With IMD Fastrax">{{cite web |title=YANGAROO Announces Partnership With IMD Fastrax |publisher=Market Wired| date=2014-12-18 |url=http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/yangaroo-announces-partnership-with-imd-fastrax-tsx-venture-yoo-1978175.html}}</ref>
